note.p: Education: BA, MA (1817) Wadham College, Oxford; LLD (Louvain)

Career: Called to the Bar (1816); QC (1837); Secretary of the second Record Commission; Queen's Serjeant of the Duchy of Lancaster; Bencher of Lincoln's Inn (1836), Treasurer (1855), Master of the library (1856)
Freemason, joined, 1852, United Industrious Lodge No 34, subsequently No 31 Canterbury
References: The Library and Museumm of Freemasonry 'Freemasons and the Royal Society;Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010, page 24
